title: ServiceNow Patches Critical AI Platform Flaw Allowing Unauthenticated User Impersonation
summary: ServiceNow has released patches for a critical security vulnerability in its AI platform that could allow unauthenticated users to impersonate legitimate accounts. The flaw, which was discovered and reported by security researchers, posed a significant risk as it could enable attackers to gain unauthorized access to sensitive information and systems. ServiceNow has urged users to apply the updates promptly to mitigate potential security breaches. This move underscores the importance of regularly updating software to protect against emerging threats and safeguard user data and system integrity.
